qas.question: In what year was Louis-Phillipe over thrown?
In what year did Napoleon III create new arrondissements?
Who was Napoleon III's prefect of the Siene?

context: Louis-Philippe was overthrown by a popular uprising in the streets of Paris in <a0_0>1848<a0_0/>. His successor, Napoleon III, and the newly appointed prefect of the Seine, <a2_0>Georges-Eugène Haussmann<a2_0/>, launched a gigantic public works project to build wide new boulevards, a new opera house, a central market, new aqueducts, sewers, and parks, including the Bois de Boulogne and Bois de Vincennes. In <a1_0>1860<a1_0/>, Napoleon III also annexed the surrounding towns and created eight new arrondissements, expanding Paris to its current limits.
